metadata.Title: CVE-2020-15655 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.Description: A redirected HTTP request which is observed or modified through a web extension could bypass existing CORS checks, leading to potential disclosure of cross-origin information. This vulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 78.1, Firefox < 79, and Thunderbird < 78.1.

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in hirsute was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '80.0.1+build1-0ubuntu1').
thunderbird package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:78.4.3+build1-0ubuntu1').
